name: Travelodge Birmingham Frankley M5 Southbound

reviews.text: The room was all you can expect from Travelodge standards. Comfy bed and very clean bathroom. Packed breakfast was quite nice (it was my first packed breakfast at these hotels chain and I could not expect more from it). Staff unhelpful in the morning when I discovered serious damages in my car´s door that someone did to it when trying to get into the car during the night. They just said that cars in their parking were left to owner´s own risk and that the only thing they could do was giving a call to the police (but they told me that as long as there were not security cameras, police probably was not going able to do anything useful). And there was not a nice word neither apologizes from any member of the staff.
reviews.title: No Security Cameras in the Hotel Parking. Cars are left at your own risk...

reviews.text: Helpful staff, arranged to supply extra bed linen. (As noted elsewhere, if you want two beds for adults, you need to specify 'one adult, one child on website when booking, or speak to hotel directly). Location OK, but not well signposted when coming from the South (need to cross motorway via a small lane). Standard of cleaning and general care of property was below that of other travelodges in the area - nothing horrible, but minor repairs not done and cleaning was pretty basic. OK for one night stay, but wouldn't recommend for longer.
reviews.title: Good staff

reviews.text: We went back to Birmingham to visit relatives this year. Decided to stay here again because we were familiar with the area and also because we were able to get one of the great deals - 19 pounds for our night's stay. It was certainly worth the price that we paid.
reviews.title: Satisfied Again

reviews.text: The room was relatively standard for TL. Quite a big room. There are four of us, so we have to use the couch and roll-out bed which lessens available floor space, but since it is a larger room it is still easy to move around. As usual, the supplies are fairly simple. They had plenty of coffee, tea, sugar & cream. However, if you like lots of toiletries supplied by the hotel, TL is not the place for you. They provide a bar of soap, but be prepared to bring everything else on your own. If you don't mind bringing your own toiletries, it is still a great deal.
reviews.title: Amazing Difference

likes.disliked: — No Hot Breakfast Available in Hotel

reviews.text: We love the fact that there is a motorway rest stop there, so we can get anything to eat there. There is a Marks and Spencers for almost anything you can imagine to eat. There are also take away places, but we prefer having the variety that M & S offers.
reviews.title: Typical Travelodge

likes.disliked: — Unmanned Reception (although the receptionists were most pleasant)

reviews.text: Stayed in family room here as every where else was full booked. Situated in motorway service area. Rooms could do with some refurbishment. If going back into Birmingham city centre, you will have to drive to the next exit to turn back to rejoin northbound.
reviews.title: Basic, as you would expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A standard travel lodge - this place is getting a bit dowdy and is ready for a freshen maybe.
reviews.title: Standard package

likes.disliked: — No quick access to decent food place - only service station food.

reviews.text: I had to ask for another towel and there were only 3 pillows in the room for two of us.
reviews.title: Good place to rest your head

reviews.text: Plenty of hot water though and TV. Local pub within walking distance from the back of the services and you can get standard motorway service station food just across the way. For £50 this offers value for money for 2 people or a family.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

likes.liked: — Try and book in advance on the internet, you can sometime get some really good deals.

reviews.text: I will return if I need to stay in the area again.
reviews.title: Fine Overnight Stop

reviews.text: I have used the Frankley Travelodge about ten times in the past year and it has always represented good value for money through booking ahead on the website. It provided clean comfortable accommodation and the staff on reception are unfailingly courteous and helpful. It is generally quiet and noise does not seem to travel. Some rooms could do with a bit of a revamp but they are always clean and serviceable; there is pretty good provision for writing and working with a laptop (although I haven't tried the internet connection. I don't mind their no frills approach to shampoos and smelly stuff but it is sometimes hard to get the liquid soap out of its small plastic bottle. The shower arrangements seem to have been improved with a more powerful shower. The beds are extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Decent for a motorway service hotel

aka: Travelodge Frankley m5 Southbound Hotel Birmingham
